page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: ROMAN AND MINING ACTIVITIES Running through the area is a Bronze Age track leading to Stapley Hill.Hemford is a derivative of Yr Hen Fford -the old road.The area also has a strong Roman connection as there are extensive lead mining dating back to those times, based on Roman Gravels.Pigs of lead bearing Hadrians name AD117-38 have been found nearby. The mining fortunes rose and fell.They rose in prominence in the 12 century and were at their peak in the 1880s.In 1883 Roman Gravels produced 3,000 tons in one year.By the 1920s mining had virtually ceased,lead having latterly given way to zinc and barytes ore excavation.The lead mining history is reflected in the landscape, disused mineshafts and remains of mining buildings remain.
